data.headline: US stock futures retreat as hawkish Fed minutes dampen rate-cut hopes and oil surges on geopolitical tensions, with retail and tech sentiment under pressure.
bullets: S&P 500 futures down 0.37%, Dow -0.32%, Nasdaq 100 -0.56%, and Russell 2000 -0.43% in early trading.
Fed minutes signal a divided, hawkish stance, curbing expectations for near-term rate cuts.
Nvidiaâ€™s recent rally fails to ease ongoing concerns about AI valuations and spending.
Oil prices jump to multi-month highs on escalating US-Iran tensions, boosting energy stocks and nudging gold higher.
Walmart drops over 3% after issuing a disappointing earnings outlook and cautious long-term EPS guidance, dragging retail lower.
Carvana plunges about 16% on mixed Q4 results and higher reconditioning costs.
DoorDash, Deere, and Quanta rally in premarket trading despite broader market caution.
Investors remain cautious ahead of key economic data releases, with no major new Fed or macro surprises so far.
